case_vignette: A 38-year-old woman comes to the physician for a 3-month history of bloody discharge from the right nipple. Her mother died of breast cancer at the age of 69 years. Mammography 6 months ago did not show any abnormalities. Examination of the breast shows expression of a small amount of serosanguinous fluid from the right nipple; there are no palpable breast masses or axillary lymphadenopathy. Ultrasonography of the right breast shows a single dilated duct.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Hematology and Oncology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having bloody discharge from my right nipple for the last three months.
Have you noticed any lumps or changes in the breast tissue?
No, there are no noticeable lumps or changes in my breast tissue.
What is your age and sex?
I am a 38-year-old woman.
Have you had any similar issues in the past, or is this the first time?
This is the first time I've had this issue.
Are you currently pregnant or breastfeeding?
No, I am not pregnant or breastfeeding.
Do you have any family history of breast cancer or other breast-related illnesses?
Yes, my mother died of breast cancer at the age of 69.
Have you experienced any changes in appetite, weight, or energy levels recently?
No, I haven't experienced any changes in appetite, weight, or energy levels recently.
Are you on any medications or have you started any new medication recently?
There's no mention of me being on any medications or starting new ones recently.
Have you had any imaging studies like a mammogram or ultrasound done for this issue?
Yes, I had a mammogram 6 months ago which didn't show any abnormalities, and a recent ultrasound showed a single dilated duct in my right breast.
Final Diagnosis: Intraductal papilloma of the breast.
